text: Bad experience. Made an order online to have it delivered on ST. Valentines day, did not happened. I called the store to ask about what happened, since I asked my wife about it and my wife said she did not received anything. So of course I am disappointed, I made the order , and hoping that while I was out of town, this would be delivered to her. No other details were offered to me, other than just " delivery was unsuccessful "... I know it was unsuccessful, duuhh!  So I asked for a complimentary delivery , the lady completely ignored my request and processed a refund. Which is ok, but you lost a client and possibly more than just me... I would not do no more business with edible arrangements , or at least with this store. Would not recommend you do any business with them.

name: Jessica White
text:
After ordering an arrangement for my mother and learning that she never received it on the intended date of delivery (Friday, Feb. 12), I called the store multiple times and was unable to reach them. After finally calling corporate I was told that the order would absolutely be ordered, likely by 9 PM (unacceptable in itself).
After it still went unreceived and I filed a formal complaint on Saturday, I was informed that they would likely be open that day due to the holiday weekend and my order would *probably* be delivered that day. Again, my delivery went unreceived.
Sunday, I called the store all day, always reaching a busy tone, but felt confident that the company would at the very LEAST deliver my order first thing that morning, despite it already being two days late. No such luck.
FINALLY today, three days after my intended delivery date, I was able to get ahold at someone at the store and let them know that I was displeased to say the least, and would like my order to still be delivered but would like the delivery fee refunded, as it did not arrive the day it should have. The person on the phone then said he cancelled my order completely (although I have yet to receive a refund), rang up another order, and charged my card AGAIN for the amount of the basket. By now, there has been $200+ worth of charges put on my card. But hey, they offered to give my mom a free box with 6 chocolate strawberries to make up for it.
After speaking with my mother, we decided to cancel the entire order and, YET AGAIN after not being able to get ahold of anyone at the store for several hours, I called corporate and asked to cancel my order and was informed not only did they have absolutely no record whatsoever of my 2nd purchase (even thought they were more than happy to charge my card earlier today), MY ORIGINAL ORDER HAD BEEN CANCELLED BY SOMEONE ON THE DAY IT WAS SUPPOSED TO BE DELIVERED. I was informed that I should try to get in contact with someone at the store (as if it's so easy) and my complaints would be passed on to the manager. This experience was absolutely DEPLORABLE as far as customer service goes and I am extremely disappointed with the lack of effort to correct the situation.

I would do edible arrangements again but definitely at another location.

name: Chelsee Farwell
text: Worst customer service ever. I live out of state and for my sisters 16th birthday we wanted to do something special for her so we decided to have an edible arrangement with balloons delivered to her high school. 72$ later they didn't deliver the balloons and when I called to get a refund for the balloons a man named Bryant answered the phone. I really just would have been fine if they were apologetic towards the situation and cared but instead in a monotone voice the response I was given was "well sometimes we miss things, do you have the card so I can refund the money". Outstanding response sir. Needless to say I told them my fiancé would call them with the card information. When he called the owner answered and again was not very sympathetic to the situation. He decided a refund wouldn't matter since the surprise for her birthday was ruined anyways. She had the balloons delivered the next day that we paid for already and a box of 6 complementary strawberries sent with it. At the end of the day if someone in this business would have ACTED like they cared that their business took away from what should have been a special sweet 16th birthday delivery I wouldn't have such a bad taste in my mouth for this company.

name: Michele Coco
text: The customer service at this franchise is HORRIBLE. the manager, Rebecca, had a horrible attitude, as did the delivery driver,  and made what was supposed to be an awesome gift a pain to receive.  I almost called back to tell them to cancel the delivery entirely and to credit the person who sent me the gift.  I was not home for the initial delivery at noon on Wednesday. I was left a message on my cell phone by the delivery man to call the store to reschedule. I called, was placed on hold and then REbecca picked up giving me some stupid line of, "They are a very busy company and cannot schedule a delivery in  set period of time." I then proceeded to ask her if I was supposed to wait here all day to receive my bouquet. She said no, I could come pick it up. They would try to make sure the bouquet was at the store when I arrived. So, wait?  You can't get it to me in a 2 ot 4 hour time period and then you will try to have it there, all the way across town, should I happen to show up?  WHAT?  How is it that FedEx, UPS and even the USPS can deliver things nationwide but this little mom/pop business that serves the Birmingham metro (population 1.5million) cannot get it together to deliver a bouquet in a 2 to 4 hour time slot?  PATHETIC.

text: The product was well received, but the employee was not wearing a mask. I asked about it and she said she had "health issues," then walked away and had someone else wait on me. That's the end of this store for me!

resp.text: Ma’am, I’m sorry you had a bad experience, but the woman who helped you at first has gone through things that you can’t possibly imagine, therefore she does not wear a mask. She even told you she has issues. That is why she got someone else to help you when you started acting like you were the mask police. I do not work there anymore, but I personally know the people that do. They are hardworking and try their hardest to please everyone and produce great arrangements. Before you go running to Google to post something bad, think about it from all sides first.

text: Had placed an order as a surprise for my sister's birthday today. I had begun to get worried when nothing was delivered at 4pm, but the lady on the phone assured me it would be delivered once the driver got back. It is now 6:39 and not only has nothing been delivered, but they are now CLOSED. I am highly infuriated and had to ruin the surprise in attempts of figuring out what all is going on. I definitely will be requesting a full refund and cancellation, as well as making a call to corporate. As I had spent over 80 dollars to be inconvenienced, even though the order was placed ahead of time.

name: Prudence Knight
text: My strawberries were old and at first; they didn’t want to take my order over the phone because I sounded “black”, I heard them whispering in the background, and when they did, the presentation was horrible. They barely wanted to open the door for me because one of them said I was going to rob them. What a mess.

name: Ultreya Park
text: Delicious! They have a ready-to-eat case with single items and a menu to order from in-store. I was looking for something healthy but fun and got the donut, which is a cross-section of an apple dipped in chocolate with coconut on top. Young woman clerk in here was super patient, friendly and helpful. Pine Brook shopping center is a good substitute mall experience, sort of going up and down the sidewalk, and had never been in here.They have three ready-to-go larger arrangements in the refrigerated case. They have balloons and cards, and deliver for a fee. My companion got a chocolate-dipped piece of pineapple in the shape of a star on a stick. They also offer fruit parfaits in a cup @$5, and cones of fruit which are the best deal, and have a binder of other items you can order. The woman answered all of my questions and wasn't in a rush and not phased when chocolate fell on the floor. Fun contest with their photo cardboard cutout.

name: Tracey Quinsey
text: My gift chocolate covered strawberries were devine.

name: Leslie Phillips
text: I placed an online order at 9:00 AM and my friend received her arrangement by lunchtime (same day).  She absolutely LOVED it .  I was very happy with the product, the ease of ordering online, and the quick (same day) delivery.

name: Bearofkratos
text: Best to call ahead before coming and picking, but never had any problems with the choices already made.

name: cindy h
text: A bit pricey but sometimes it is the perfect gift in the summertime!

name: mark christianson
text: Fresh, clean giant sushi rolls. Bowls are nice too. Definitely going back

name: Wedia Billups
text: Awesome place to shop for beautiful fruit arrangements.

name: Carla Owens
text: I’m a frequent customer, amazing customer service, beautiful and fresh product! Never disappointed!

name: Roland Hayes
text:
READ THE REVIEWS-YOU WILL SEE I'M NOT THE ONLY ONE WITH THIS PROBLEM!
I placed my order on Wednesday, August 15, 2018 for an arrangement for my Brother and Sister-in-law who's daughter had died 25 years ago this week and I just wanted to send them something to let them know I was thinking about them.  I ask the representative when was the soonest they could deliver the arrangement?  She told me they could deliver it around 12 Noon on Thursday, August 16, 2018.  I told her that would be great and to please get it there as close to Noon as possible.  She said they would.  I called Edible Arrangements at 12:30pm to see if my order had been delivered. The lady told me it was on the table being finished.  I told her it was supposed to be delivered at Noon and asked her when would it be delivered.  She told me by 2pm.  Bottom line, they did not get the arrangement delivered until 4:45pm and where they had to deliver it to was less than 3 miles from the Edible Arrangements shop.  I called and spoke to the manager and she didn't care at all about the problem and said there was no way they could have gotten it there by Noon.  I ordered it the day before. They open at 8am and you can't fix, arrange and deliver an arrangement by Noon and it is less than 3 miles from your place of business?  Something is wrong with your Business Plan then.  I called and complained to corporate  and they said they would have the owner call me from the Mobile, Alabama location but, I have not received a call yet.  I spent over $100.00 and the business delivered it when they wanted to not, when I wanted them to.  If I don't hear from the owner this week, I'm sending it to my attorney. I know it's just a $100.00 but, it's about the principle of the matter.  This business did not do what they said they would do and they have not even offered an apology, much less a refund.  Well, I expect a call and if I don't get one, it will most certainly cost them more than$100.00.  I don't want to have to do this but, it's time people are held accountable for their actions and it starts now for Edible Arrangements in Mobile,  Alabama.

name: Phil Jones
text: I have never had any problems with any Edible Arrangements location except this one.  After waiting in line on Valentine's Day for almost TWO hours for an order I had placed online, I finally had to leave and get a different V Day present.  Nobody ever came outside to give updates or give reasons for anything. People who had previously ordered days before were coming out saying their order wasn't even done!  It was so disorganized and confusing, and NOBODY was coming out happy.   I would personally like my money back, but the only thing we got was management sending a letter a week later saying they were "sooooo sorry" (actual quote, which shows how "professional" they are).  They should have had a line for order pick-ups, and then a different line for people last minute ordering. Or they could have at least had someone come out and explain whatever the heck was going on inside the store. Very disappointed and I was definitely not the only one.

name: Bailey Whittington
text: I spoke with a Mr. Colten today who was perfect and gave me every bit of information i needed and more. His customer service skills are excellent. Highly recommended!!

resp.text: Bailey Whittington, we're so glad everything worked out for you! Would you like us to enter a compliment to the location on your behalf. If so, please e-mail us at orderteam@edible.com. We'd love to share this with that management team!

name: Angela Haynes
text:
Terrible customer service, ordered for Valentine's day, went to pick up at my arranged time, stood in line 2 hrs, still not ready. Won't order from this store
ever again. Will order from Shari's berries.They don't even deserve 1 star

name: Andrew Conant
text:
Called the day before my wife's birthday to get her some strawberries, pineapples, and bananas all covered in chocolate. For whatever reason they thought I said no bananas and add apples. I'm sure it was a misunderstanding of some sort. MAKE SURE YOU DOUBLE CHECK YOUR ORDER WHEN YOU ORDER OVER THE PHONE.
I contacted the store to tell then what happened and the last laughed and said "well the apples and pineapples are really good." That's not the point. My wife loves chocolate covered bananas and she didn't get any of them.
I called back and spoke with a man who said I could come back by and pick up the bananas, thus salvaging later purchases from me.

resp.text: Andrew Conant We’re very sorry we disappointed you. Please email us at orderteam@edible.com with your order details, and we will look into this farther for you.

text: Keshawn was so sweet! Excellent customer service. He went above and beyond and his employer is lucky to have him!

text: Ordered and wanted something delivered paid over $200 to have it delivered today and was told over and over it was out for delivery but it was never delivered I’m very disappointed and will be looking to get my full refund back being that I never received my items at all but I already paid Smh never order anything from this place or place a delivery because you won’t get it at all 👎🏼👎🏼👎🏼👎🏼👎🏼

text: I had a simple order. 3 artificial roses wrapped in plastic paper. I was traveling to Huntsville to a cemetery to pay my respects to someone I never knew personally. I called them because they were on my drive route. They were beautiful...wrapped in lace plastic wrapping with a bow. I appreciate it so much.

name: Jacob Atwell
text: Beautiful place, calm environment, the air is very fresh.

name: Bradley Walker
text: They were very professional and helpful with getting flowers delivered. I would highly recommend this business to anyone that is looking for exceptional service and beautiful flowers. Thank you for the outstanding customer service!

name: Dorothy Larmore
text: We ordered a flower arrangement for a dear friend of ours in her time of loss. I could not have been happier with the flowers or the stuffed animal we got her (she sleeps with it every night and named it after the person she lost.). My friend LOVED her gifts! We will order again in the near future!

name: Cynthia Mcwhirter
text: Purchased flowers for funeral of family friend.  Received call that arrangement I ordered was not available and they would make something comparable.  Flowers they provided were beautiful.  I would recommend them to anyone.

name: Cherie
text: Friendly service and reasonable prices.  For Valentine's Day they have nice little buckets filled with candy, snacks, and plushes and will deliver them to the schools. Only negatives the exterior conditions, you definitely would not know it was a florist by the outside plants around the building.

name: Stuart Herring
text: I like to shop locally, so I chose Pinedale Gardens as my florist. I'm glad that I did, because of their good selection, friendly and helpful staff, and nice prices. Highly recommended!

name: Ray Burnett
text: I will always go to pinedale gardens for all of my floral needs. Like on Feb. 3 2018 I bought my wife one dozen red roses for her birthday. She loved them, and the roses were rather reasonable too
